Combining Stats
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Combining Stats
By Manakete on Monday, December 5, 2005 - 11:20 am:

I am going to start researching on resulting stats from combining monsters. Let me know if you want to help.

By Lisa Shock on Monday, December 5, 2005 - 11:51 am:

IIRC, if the parents are trained above the baseline, they pass over a percentage of their stats over the baseline to the offspring, just like in MRA.

By Lisa Shock on Monday, December 5, 2005 - 11:52 am:

Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance Archive (GameBoy Advance): FAQ: Combining Formula: Stats Carryover

By Manakete on Tuesday, December 6, 2005 - 08:04 am:

I found nothing there.

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, December 6, 2005 - 09:14 am:

" multiply 10% to their stats, round up to the main, round down for the secondary, then add those numbers from each breed to the baseline stats of whatever is the resulting breed."

By Manakete on Tuesday, December 6, 2005 - 11:42 am:

Cool! Sorry for causing trouble. And thanks for the info.

By Manakete on Friday, December 23, 2005 - 10:32 pm:

Just got done combining a truckload of monsters, I have discovered that the function for finding combining stats listed above is not true for this game.

By Anonymous on Saturday, December 24, 2005 - 06:22 am:

I hope your planning on posting some examples/findings because that isn't a very helpful post Manakete.

By John Hawley on Saturday, December 24, 2005 - 07:21 am:

We're going to need to see your math. Plus are you remembering to round down for anything from .5 and under? The game engine rounds down for main, sub and hybrid at that point. Especially the hybrid.
